description: Faction representatives discreetly receive redacted segments of system recovery protocols from Nikola in a back booth at Bar 101, sparking immediate behind-the-scenes maneuvering.

Open rivalry among Council factions disrupts BCI management, leading to visible service outages and erratic access across public utilities. Confused citizens begin gathering near government outposts, demanding answers.

BCI scoring becomes unreliable across housing, employment, and transit services; some people are locked out of their jobs and apartments, while others gain unexpected privileges. City mood shifts from inconvenience to visible unrest.

Directorate security units physically block Harmonist engineers from BCI server rooms, blaming them for ongoing instability. Tension escalates inside the Council, with accusations exchanged over who lost control.

Groups of citizens hold sit-ins and improvised vigils at service centers after repeated BCI errors deny them essential access. Unofficial footage circulates, drawing sympathy in some circles and anxiety in others.

With no clear message from leadership, everyday life is shaped by unpredictable BCI shifts. Citizens start developing rituals and rumors for 'calming the system,' driving uncertainty and quiet resentment beneath the surface.
